Name: Shabti of Sethos I
Description: The Museum of Brussels posesses four shabtis of the pharaoh Sethos I.  Only one (E.8386) is made in blue faience, the other three (E.5551, E.5563A - B) in wood. This wooden example shows the king bandaged wearing a long wig. The arms are crossed on the chest and the hands hold two hoes. The hieroglyphic text, badly deteriorated, is borrowed from Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead. The figurine, of which the lower part is slightly damaged, was originally painted in black.
